title.rendered: Be careful receiving phone calls from these area codes

content.rendered:
The Telecommunications Regulation and Control Agency, Arcotel, warned on Tuesday, July 18, 2017, mobile phone users in the country of the new phone scam. This consists of an international call, also known as the ‘missed call scam’.

Most of the calls came with the prefix 00 675 corresponding to Papua New Guinea, but users have warned that international calls have also been registered with other prefixes such as 00 1 264 which belongs to the islands of Eela British Overseas Territory, located in the Caribbean.

This type of scam has also been registered in other countries. According to the Telemundo Houston portal, the calls can come from different places such as Bahamas, Bermuda and more. Inc.com has listed the area codes from which care should be taken when answering calls.

How this type of scam works is relatively simple: Users receive a call that is missed. Not being able to answer, some users return the call. That is where the scam is executed.

This fraudulent telephone practice called ‘Wangiri’ is carried out with the use of telecommunications infrastructure located abroad and can cause considerable economic damage to those users who return the international call.

“For this reason, it is necessary to warn users that if they receive this type of call, they should not return it for any reason, in this way economic costs will be avoided for the duration of the call,” said Arcotel.

Reported area codes:

00 1 264 – Angila Island
00 675 – Papua New Guinea
00 239 – São Tomé Island
00 246 – British Indian Ocean Territory

Other area codes prefixing the numbers 00 1:

242 – Bahamas
441 – Bermuda
784 – St. Vincent and the Grenadines
246 – Barbados
473 – Grenada, Carriacou, and Petite Martinique
649 – Turks and Caicos
868 – Trinidad and Tobago
268 – Ancient
664 – Montserrat
876 – Jamaican
284 – British Virgin Islands
721 – Saint Maarten
758 – St Lucia
869 – St. Kitts and Nevis
345 – Cayman Islands
767 – Dominican
684 – American Samoa
671 – Guam
